meanings.definition: Gain or acquire knowledge or skill through study, experience, or being taught.
meanings.sent1: Children learn new things at school every day.
meanings.sent2: I learn how to play the piano by practicing regularly.
meanings.sent3: The cat learned that knocking over the vase was not a good idea.
meanings.sent4: She learned the hard way that honesty is the best policy.
meanings.sent5: Through hard work and dedication, he learned to speak fluent Spanish.

meanings.sent1: Students learn their multiplication tables to remember them easily.
meanings.sent2: I learn my favorite poem so I can recite it from memory.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel learned where it buried its acorns after a long search.
meanings.sent4: She learned the song lyrics by heart after listening to it many times.
meanings.sent5: By repeating the information, he learned the important dates for the history test.

meanings.sent1: We learn that the store is closed on Sundays.
meanings.sent2: I learn that my friend is moving away next month.
meanings.sent3: The detective learned the identity of the mysterious caller.
meanings.sent4: She learned the truth about her family history after reading old letters.
meanings.sent5: Through careful observation, he learned the secret hiding spot of the treasure.
